items.title: Sources: PSG finalizing deal for Barcelona starlet
items.summary: Paris Saint-Germain are finalising the remaining details for the transfer of Dro Fern√°ndez, the latest prodigy from Barcelona's academy, sources confirmed to ESPN.

items.title: Arteta: Arsenal denied clear penalty in Forest draw
items.summary: Mikel Arteta has said Arsenal were denied a "very clear penalty" in Saturday's 0-0 draw at Nottingham Forest.

items.title: Wrexham captain McClean exits, joins Derry City
items.summary: Wrexham have announced that their club captain James McLean has moved to Derry City.

items.title: Slot 'understands' Liverpool fans' boos after draw
items.summary: Arne Slot said he "completely understands" the frustration of the Liverpool fans who booed the team following Saturday's 1-1 draw with Burnley in the Premier League.

items.title: Man United deliver huge blow to Man City title hopes with shock derby win
items.summary: Manchester City's title bid is as good as over after Manchester United won the midfield battle at Old Trafford.

items.title: Mauro J√∫nior verbreekt assistrecord tijdens Fortuna - PSV
items.summary: PSV ging zaterdagavond op bezoek bij Fortuna Sittard, en de ploeg van Peter Bosz behaalde er de dertiende Eredivisie-zege op rij. Lees het verloop van de avond terug in deze VI Live.

items.title: Holtby kapot na nederlaag NAC: 'Breekt onze harten'
items.summary: Lewis Holtby zag NAC Breda in de absolute slotfase verliezen van NEC. Een nieuwe dreun voor de Bredanaars, die hard aankwam bij de Duitse routinier. Na afloop sprak hij met verslaggever Kalum van Oudheusden.

items.title: NEC wil de markt op om vervanger voor Shiogai aan te trekken
items.summary: De winterse transfermarkt is geopend. In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in Nederland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in het buitenland.

items.title: 'Schalke wil stunten met komst Dzeko, Chelsea aast op Frans talent'
items.summary: De tijd van winterse versterkingen is aangebroken, in dit blog volgen we alle transferactiviteit in het buitenland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in Nederland.

items.title: Frank‚Äôs future in doubt as Romero calls West Ham defeat ‚Äòa disaster‚Äô for Spurs
items.summary: Manager barracked by fans after late 2-1 defeat Romero comments add to sense of unease at Tottenham Thomas Frank‚Äôs future as the Tottenham manager is in doubt after Saturday‚Äôs last-gasp 2-1 home defeat by West Ham, at which the club‚Äôs supporters called for him to be ‚Äúsacked in the morning‚Äù. The Spurs hierarchy have been mindful of the difficulties Frank has faced during what was always likely to be a transitional season. The chief executive, Vinai Venkatesham, wrote an open letter to fans on Saturday morning, the tone of which was supportive, the overriding message being a call for patience. Continue reading...

items.title: Mourinho boekt zakelijke zege met Benfica en kruipt weer wat dichter bij FC Porto
items.summary: Zaterdagmiddag stonden er niet alleen vijf wedstrijden in de Eredivisie op het programma, maar ook in het buitenland stonden ons veel mooie potjes te wachten. Te beginnen met de Manchester Derby, gevolgd door onder meer Real Madrid, Liverpool, Arsenal, Bayern M√ºnchen en Internazionale. Je volgde het (inter)nationale voetbal in deze VI Live.

items.title: Carrick proves Man Utd DNA isn't a myth - Hits and misses
Two-time winners Munster dumped out of Champions Cup; Leicester on cusp of exit
items.summary: Two-time European winners Munster were dumped out of the Champions Cup at the pool stage for just the fourth time since 1999 as they were stunned by Castres at Thomond Park 31-29.

items.title: Arsenal stumble in draw against resilient Forest
items.summary: Arsenal missed the chance to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table to nine points, with a goalless draw against a determined Nottingham Forest.

items.title: Ruthless Man Utd beat Man City in dream start for Carrick
items.summary: Michael Carrick gets off to the perfect start in his first match as interim manager for Manchester United with a two-goal derby win against Manchester City, leaving Pep Guardiola's side winless in their past four matches.

items.title: Wasteful Liverpool miss penalty in draw against Burnley
items.summary: Liverpool missed countless chances, including a Dominik Szoboszlai penalty, as a Michael Edwards equaliser grabbed Burnley an important point at Anfield.

items.title: Last-minute Wilson goal leaves fans booing Frank's Spurs
items.summary: A last-minute Callum Wilson goal gives West Ham an important three points and increases the pressure on Tottenham boss Thomas Frank.

items.title: Chelsea beat Brentford for Rosenior's first Premier League win
items.summary: Cole Palmer scored a penalty to secure the a for Chelsea against Brentford and give Liam Rosenior his first Premier League win as manager.

items.title: 'Sinner, Anisimova to claim Australian Open titles as Brits dealt tough draws'
items.summary: Sky Sports Tennis' Gigi Salmon looks ahead to the 2026 Australian Open, revealing her tips to claim the titles and looking at each Brit's draw in her latest column.

items.title: Arteta rails at Arsenal being denied ‚Äòclear penalty‚Äô as Forest hold leaders
items.summary: Mikel Arteta was adamant his team should have been awarded a penalty for handball by Ola Aina 10 minutes from time that would have given Arsenal the opportunity to move nine points clear at the top of the Premier League. Instead Nottingham Forest hung on gamely for a doughty goalless draw in a performance redolent of the team last season who were pushing for European qualification. They may only be five points clear of the relegation zone, after West Ham‚Äôs last-gasp win at Tottenham, but Sean Dyche was understandably proud of his team‚Äôs efforts that suggest Forest are moving in the right direction. Continue reading...
